title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 166-1.4 - Measurement of profitability
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 §§ 166-1.4 - Measurement of profitability

State Regulations
(a) Profitability shall be measured by relating profits to net worth rather than to sales or total capital. (b) Section
2323
of the Insurance Law states that rates of return on net worth, assets and premiums earned shall be calculated. Section 2329 requires that an excess profit be defined in terms of return on net worth. (c) See section
166-2.4
of this Part for discussion of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11
§§
166-1.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
